intro: Pentacalia nunezii, commonly known as the Núñez's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
